dataList.dlg:
- Hm. I'd pull them back somewhat if I were you.
- Hey, it says here that we only have to cheer them on, not give them tactical advice.

- Mission start.
- Read the patterns and stay focused, okay?
- And once it starts, never stop pulling the trigger until it's over.

- Retreating and regrouping might be in order.
- No enemies in the rear. If you're gonna retreat, now's the time.
- I think they still have this. As long as they have something up their sleeves...

- Hm... Looking a bit exhausted.
- And so it goes.
- Not to mention the breach of contract charges.

- You've got an opening. A clear shot...
- It only takes one shot.
- ... Guys, this isn't our contract.

- They're all gonna die at this rate.
- A tighter formation might help withstand the next few waves.

- Target elimination confirmed.
- Now that's a positive sign. Don't lose focus now, though.

- You're losing your ranks...
- Well, that's the City for you. Stay on your toes, or you'll be the first in line to the slaughterhouse.

- They're still fighting? They should just drop their weapons and—
- What the hell are you talking about?!
- You don't just throw away your weapons.

- I like a good turnabout.
- Turnabout my ass, we always barely escape from the missions with our lives.
- We've always won in the end. That's what matters.

- Remember that one time? When we had just one bullet left between us.
- And three remaining enemies. Tamaki finished them with a single shot, though.
- Maybe they'll pull off something similar.

- Something's going on over there...
- That one. It's getting ready for something, that's for sure.

- Which Workshop is that from? I've never seen anything like—
- It might not be from a Workshop at all. What if it's a Singularity-based weapon?

- Fire for effect. Very good.
- Yep. Keep up the pace.

- What a waste of ammunition...
- Just how many are they throwing away by shooting at something they can't even penetrate?

- Ooh, that was a good call. 
- It's important to observe your enemies closely rather than firing blindly.

- Gotta use the right bullet for the right target.
- Well... I'm sure that's a piece of advice that applies to more than just the bullets. Probably.

- They look pretty fired up... Maybe they took something.
- Yeah, no. This is not a good time for an attack.

- Zoom in over here.
- Hm... They're not doing so good. Time to press the attack.

- Looking good.
- At this rate, they might even be able to challenge contracts of a higher difficulty.

- I'm going nuts over here... What are they waiting for?
- Low morale, maybe. Might be a good idea to briefly regroup for now.

- Target parts are blown off.
- Good. That's one hole plugged.

- Yes! Open fire!
- Right. Let's not get too excited and take it slow—
- Take it slow my ass! Can't they just focus fire at the broken part?

- I don't know what else they can do against those enemies.
- Yeah, I don't see a way to close that gap. Looks like they're shit outta luck.

- Just outta curiosity. What'll you do if I get blasted to near-death by an attack like that?
- Leave you behind. Not much I can do.
- ... Okay, I did expect that answer. But still.

- We really gotta get someone like that on board...
- We're not at financial liberty to hire more people.

- That was impressive.
- A lot of damage coming from one person. That was something else.

- Wow, now that's a rare sight~ Damn!
- This'll be worth looking into later.
- Mhm. I'll remember this.
The Church guys'll be swarming you soon... Stay sharp and check if your weapons are in good shape!
There's no end to them, these weirdos with gears crammed into their heads... Keep your eyes on your ammo count, okay?
That's the last one... But something tells me they're dangerous. Don't get complacent.

- It's a simple contract this time. We just sit here, watch a video, and make some commentary.
- Nice~ Looks like we'll get to save on some bullet expenses.
- I appreciate opportunities to do some nonviolent work.
